faq.question: What makes a good sound bite?
faq.answer: Good sound bites are short (under 15 words), use vivid language, and express a clear point of view. They're easy to quote and hard to forget.

faq.question: How do I use sound bites in interviews?
faq.answer: Prepare 3-5 sound bites before any interview. Work them naturally into your answers - they become the quotes that get shared.

faq.question: Should I use them on social media?
faq.answer: Absolutely! Sound bites make perfect social posts. They're shareable, memorable, and establish your thought leadership.

faq.question: How many should I have ready?
faq.answer: Build a collection of 10-15 signature phrases. Review and update them quarterly as your messaging evolves.
